section.text: *NOTE: This section was created by emergency legislation that will expire on October 25, 2023.*
section.heading: Call data collection and posting.

para.text: On a monthly basis, the Office shall collect and publicly post on the Office's website the number of calls eligible to be diverted and the number of calls actually diverted to the:
Department of Behavioral Health Access Help Line;
District Department of Transportation for motor vehicle collisions that do not result in an injury;
Department of Public Works for parking enforcement; and
Fire and Emergency Medical Services Department Nurse Triage Line.
On a monthly basis, the Office shall publicly post the following information on the Office's website:
Descriptions of each call-taker and dispatcher error, the cause of the error, and the corrective action taken by the Office;
Number of shifts operated under minimum staffing levels;
Average and maximum call to answer times;
Average and maximum answer to dispatch times;
Number of calls in the queue for over 15 seconds;
Number of calls dropped following a queue time of over 15 seconds; and
Number and type of 911 misuse calls.

annotations.annotation: For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 2 of Office of Unified Communications Transparency and Accuracy Emergency Amendment Act of 2023 (D.C. Act 25-198, July 27, 2023, 70 DCR 10746).
